snippet: A local court sentenced dozens of defendants, including a former military chief of staff, to long prison terms for their role in plotting to overthrow Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
abstract: Turkish court sentences dozens of high-ranking military officers, politicians, journalists and others to long prison terms for plotting to overthrow Islamist government; ruling is latest chapter in long-running case that has exposed deep divisions within Turkish society between Islamists and secularists.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Izmir, and Tim Arango from Baghdad. Christine Hauser contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A local court sentenced dozens of defendants, including a former military chief of staff, to long prison terms for their role in plotting to overthrow Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.main: Turkish Court Hands Down Prison Sentences in Coup Plot
headline.print_headline: Turkish Court Hands Down Prison Sentences in Coup Plot

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
